We must, now more than ever, defend the rights of transgender people. That's why we're launching the Transgender Education and Advocacy Program.
  

Join the team

Submit your request for proposal (RFP) for the Missouri Transgender Education Program Coordinator position today.

Apply today

Dear ##first_name[Supporter]##,

In the past year, political and legislative attacks on transgender Americans have increased across the nation and here in Missouri.

We believe trans and gender nonconforming people have the right to be themselves. That's why we're launching the Transgender Education and Advocacy Program.

Join our team! We are searching for a dynamic consultant to become our statewide coordinator and work with regional transgender partners, volunteers, policymakers and the community to make Missouri a more inclusive place to live, work and go to school.

Apply today or send this opportunity to a friend.

We're fighting for transgender service members to serve with dignity and respect. We sued the Trump administration over the president's directive banning transgender service members from continuing to serve in the military or receiving medically necessary health care, and banning transgender people from enlisting.

We fought for Gavin Grimm, who just wanted to use the bathroom at his Virginia high school. The ACLU took his case all the way up to the U.S. Supreme Court.

We must increase understanding of the transgender community and stop the attacks that have become all too common. Stay tuned for more on this program in 2018 as we look to share your stories and connect with you across the state.

Sincerely,

Jeffrey A. Mittman
Executive Director
ACLU of Missouri
